intro: Astragalus winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Astragalus winkleri is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
